person_445.name: Pythagoras
person_445.description: Pythagoras of Samos was an ancient Ionian Greek philosopher, polymath, and the eponymous founder of Pythagoreanism. Believed in the primacy of number.

person_002.name: AnnaBeddoes
person_002.description: Anna Beddoes, née Edgeworth, the wife of Thomas Beddoes who befriended Davy when he arrived in Bristol. Critics have speculated that they had an affair because Davy wrote poems to Anna and she wrote poems for him that he copied out in his notebooks.

person_861.name: Euclid
person_861.description: An ancient Greek mathematician, geometer and logician. Considered the "father of geometry", he is chiefly known for the Elements treatise, which established the foundations of geometry that largely dominated the field until the early 19th century.

person_693.name: RenéDescartes
person_693.description: French natural philosopher and mathematician, a seminal figure in the emergence of modern philosophy and science. Mathematics was central to his method of inquiry, and he connected the previously separate fields of geometry and algebra into analytic geometry.

person_460.name: GerolamoCardano
person_460.description: Italian polymath and writer whose interests included mathematics, medicine, natural philosophy, alchemy, astrology, astronomy and philosophy.

place_988.name: Parnassus
place_988.description: A mountain in Greece, sacred in mythology and a metaphor for the arts and learning.

place_071.name: London
place_071.description: The capital city of England and the United Kingdom.
